messages.content: Oddly enough nibble and lick counts as a lick and can be recursed

My lick tier list
5. double lick
4. haunting lick
3. nibble and lick
2. mega lick
1. sampling lick
okay discord, thank you for messing up my counting
Imagine if the numbers were counting down from 5 to 1, discord just tries to autocorrect your numbers and it fails miserably
I think double lick and sampling lick should have their rarities swapped.
And haunting being worse than nibble may come as a shock, but vulnerable does not increase goop damage
And nibble works like <it looks tasty> but as a 0 cost. It can consume then also set up your next consume as well, which is good.

embeds.title: It Looks Tasty
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 8 (10) damage. **Consume** - Gain a Lick. (+.)

messages.content: Plus now that it is 4 damage it is not bad damage on its own, it's the same amount of raw damage as double lick but double proccing consume is good for early game heals and late game goop armor block
It is two cards so does worse into Neow/Wacther3
Wacther
what if we took shrug it off but made it block for like 20

this is extremely good in the slimeboss style of deck that only uses 1 kind of lick and cycles it over and over again (most commonly this is the blocking lick card, which when paired with recollect blocks for at least 12 and then 6 more with goop armor)
its less good when you dont know what lick your gonna get, but its still worth using
2 licks. You take 2 of them since just desserts.
Oh wait never mind I misread
you said 1 kind of lick.
If possible I mix and match sampling and mega lick. The weak is pretty gosh darn good.
Sampling lick is the best one since block is probably better than weak (with 2x copies of grow it is) and it's also in the common pool so you usually can get it first

I tend to prefer sticking with only one kind of each lick unless I have a good reason to just start taking every lick I see (like with waste not). This is because licks kinda need an upgrade and licks thud really hard into some fights when they are all you have in your deck (watcher and chosen come to mind). Its most helpful with cards like Hungary tackle and recollect.
I don't think I have taken more than 2 licks since the nerf to just desserts like... 6 months ago or so
<Hungary tackle> relies much more on that playstyle then recollect though since its a more specific card; were as recollect can just be taken as a good generic block card.

embeds.title: Hungry Tackle
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 10 (14) damage.
Take 3 damage.
**Exhume** a random "Lick" card.

messages.content: I think waste not is a massive trap that heavily restricts a lot of your deckbuilding options for not enough payoff.
recovering the block or vulnerable lick is really helpful for hungry tackle; were as others like nibble and lick don't help nearly as much
Nibble and Lick REQUIRES <goop armor> to be useful basically

embeds.title: Goop Armor
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Gain 3 (4) **Block** :p_block: whenever you **Consume.**

messages.content: As it is 0 cost it looks tasty basically
waste still scales extremely well when you do have the support to use it with; its just hard to take when slimeboss wants a relatively small deck a lot of the time

Yes but it severely limits you in just about every way possible. You can't take any cards that generate basic licks, as those will now flood your discard pile. You also need to upgrade these licks, as an unupgraded lick is pretty damn horrible. You also need to upgrade waste not to actually use it more than once. So in total you are already skipping out on like 8-10 cards (basic lick generators) including nibble and lick, you are tacking basically every other lick you see and upgrading it, it makes other lick exhume options worse since you don't know what lick they will get, and you are spending most campfires upgrading them.
It honestly draws a lot of parallels to searing blow now that I think about it
Of course if you get early toxic egg disregard everything I said, take every lick you see especially if you already have waste not.

you don't need to upgrade waste not for quite a while, it basically wins fights on its own when its played the first time. You also don't need to take every single lick, you can stop at like 7. It does make the other recursion cards worse though
its viable to just have waste not left unupgraded until the end of act 3 really; most enemies will just die if you drop a handful of licks on them all at once a second time.
cards like <viscious tackle> kill extremely effectively with enough goop stacked up

It's not horrible, it just locks you into a really specific play style and I don't like that.

well your hopefully finding like 2 or 3 licks that are already upgraded. Plus as long as you have enough upgraded licks its fine for some to not draw you cards when you recover them. As long as your discard pile does not get overflowed with unupgraded licks or normal licks
The problem is then in the first deck cycle you have dead draws
An unupgraded lick is pretty garbage
thats true, but you will also have other cards like spear tackle, prepare and shape of puddle to get you thrugh that
I just don't see the vision honestly, waste not is just too much work for not enough payoff
I agree that its a lot of work but they payoff is definitely there. The card really can just win the fight for you by itself.
Problem is this: lick recursion already is very strong and can often win most fights anyway without having to have triple the investment.
but I don't want to win the fights I want to DESTROY the fights :lick:
okay then play the cursed or human
or collector
slime boss has a lot of ways it can go. Thats what make the character interesting to me; even though that variety is obtained through slime boss being pretty OP.

I think it has some potential that is lost on the community since it doesn't have the largest player base, but I think it's still average strength
No clear weaknesses, but no excessive strengths either

messages.content: nah flame tackle sucks

I'm always late to these
I haven't really found a use for this, though I'm not very good at Slimbo

Quite a solid value card. This is just very efficient block per energy, and it draws you a card most of the time (depends how many licks are in your deck), sometimes 2 cards if it's getting back an upgraded lick. It definitely feels and plays similarly to shrug it off. It's raw efficiency makes it a great tool for surviving the difficult act 2 hallways and elite fights, and can also be helpful in acts 3 and 4 as part of a larger mitigation package. It's worth noting that slime boss doesn't have all that many "block cards", which makes recollect even better than normal since it doesn't have much competition. Upgrade is bog standard, and is fine to take if it's one of your only block cards, but usually not a priority. Good with ink bottle and letter opener since it lets you play 2 cards/skills for 1 energy.

The only real drawback here is the chance that you haven't yet put a lick into your exhaust pile, in which case the block is still fairly good for the energy. You may want to consider grabbing additional licks to up your density if you have multiple copies of recollect (or other effects like it), though there is also a very popular strategy where you always recur the same lick (sampling+, double+, mega+) for maximum value and to save on upgrades. I think either strategy can work well with recollect, as long as you're consistent with your deckbuilding. It's also not a great act 1 card, since it's a block skill, and the lick it gets back is often also going to be a skill. You also may not have a good lick to recur yet, and it might not be upgraded either. The goop does poorly into tri-sentries as well, though it is quite good against lagavulin. If you just fought nob and are in good shape to clear act 1, then you could take this to prepare for act 2. Overall I think this card is in a very good place as far as balance is concerned, it does it's job well without crowding out other options.
it seems to me that the consensus of this card is lick reursion good which makes me really happy
good block and brings back a good card whats not to love about it
this card becomes a shrug with extra benefit (depending on the lick card)
which is very good value for a one cost
